item.title: Clinton Global Intiative: Web Producer (New Media Specialist)
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: www.clintonglobalinitiative.org

The Web Producer (New Media Specialist) plays a key role in the areas of Web site design/development and online communications production.
Responsibilities

The Web Producer is responsible for:

* Developing front-end Web site components * Managing and publishing content * Integrating Web-based communication tools * Building out Web pages * Maintaining and updating Clinton Foundation Web sites * Overseeing back-end functionality of all online properties * In addition, the Web Producer assists with: o Development of e-News o Online fundraising projects o Implementation of Web site features, including media-rich components o Management and hosting of domains

Skills Required

* Proficient with the following scripting languages and technologies: HTML, CSS I, CSS II, DHTML, JavaScript. * Experienced in Web page design, layout and construction – both hand-coding and using WYSIWYG tools, such as DreamWeaver. * Ability to develop and test Web content for cross-platform and cross-browser Internet display, and to manage content from a variety of departments (Communications, Marketing, Digital Media, Development, etc.) * Demonstrated skill in application of Web usability standards, information design, and principles of search engine optimization. * Experienced with the Linux server environment, and knowledgeable of the PHP scripting language and the MySQL relational database. * Familiarity with server-side scripting, database connectivity, RSS feeds, and third-party tool integration. * Knowledgeable of Web site analytics, content management systems (CMS), CRM tools such as Blackbaud Net Community, blogging platforms, pod casting, and Web site hosting.

Qualifications

* The Web Producer is Mac and PC literate, and will have a minimum of three years experience in professional Web production, new media and/or interactive work. * The successful candidate will demonstrate an attention to detail, be skilled at time management, communicate effectively, have the ability to work both as a member of a team and independently, and be committed to the mission of the Foundation and its initiatives. * A Bachelor’s degree is required; an advanced degree is preferred.

item.title: Meltwater Group: Senior Program Manager - Senior Faculty
item.description:
Location: Accra, Ghana
URL: http://www.meltwater.com

Senior Program Manager – Senior Faculty

The following description is quite detailed. Our intention is to provide insight into the opportunity so that you can make a well-informed choice.

Opportunity Overview
If you want to make an impact in the global community, here is your once in a lifetime opportunity. . .

As a Senior Faculty member at Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST), based in Accra, Ghana, you will join a team of individuals working to develop and train African software entrepreneurs.

With over 2 million residents, Accra is the capital of Ghana and its largest city. Located on the coast of West Africa, Accra is one of the wealthiest and most modern cities in the African continent. You will work alongside other Senior Faculty and join a team that includes some of the most talented members of Meltwater’s corporate team, as well as teaching assistants recruited from top international universities.

You will enjoy the excitement of being a key contributor in establishing the institute and will be a critical force in developing Africa’s technology generation.

Meltwater Group, the Company
Meltwater is a fast growing IT company developing and selling software solutions to businesses and organizations worldwide. Meltwater group has 42 offices globally and more than 12,000 of the world’s most successful companies and organizations on its client list.

MEST
Meltwater Entrepreneurial School of Technology (MEST) is a not-for-profit NGO funded by Meltwater Group. It is the realization of our belief in corporate social responsibility and our vision to give some of our knowledge and resources back to the world. Based in an area of the world carefully chosen for maximum impact, MEST’s mission is to train and develop young African entrepreneurs to become future players in the global information technology industry.

MEST is a post-graduate program for a select group of some of Africa’s highest potential students, all with undergraduate degrees and a passion for technology and entrepreneurship. The end goal is to equip these students with the tools and confidence to start new software companies and generate wealth locally.

Our Requirements
Essential attributes:
• A belief in social change and a passion for teaching/developing young people.
• Charisma and enthusiasm, ability to set the tone for an exciting learning atmosphere.
• Excellent communication skills and fluency in English.
• The ability to commit to a two year contract in Accra, Ghana.

We are looking for individuals who have the ability to:
• Develop and manage a business and technology curriculum that includes current trends and best practices in software development and elements required for a comprehensive business plan.
• Create and deliver lectures; think out-of-the box and be creative in ways to effectively teach software development using interactive methods, rather than strict text-book style in order to encourage independent thinking.
• Manage a small staff of junior teaching assistants, who will assist in delivering lecture and lab material.
• Act as a positive role model and mentor to entrepreneurs-in training and teaching assistants.
• Motivate and inspire small teams of entrepreneurs-in-training in completing software development projects by creating a positive and dynamic learning environment.
• Analyze project deliverables, conduct performance evaluations and give constructive feedback.
• Coach trainees in developing their critical thinking abilities and strengthening their interpersonal and communication skills.
• Introduce trainees to the latest business practices in the global market.

We are looking for individuals who have:
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or closely related field. (Master’s, Ph.D. a plus)
• Bachelor’s degree in Business or Entrepreneurship (Master’s a plus)
• Previous teaching experience at the college level or corporate training experience.
• 10 or more years of technology/business working experience; 5 or more years of developing or managing web development and or/mobile projects using recent technologies.
• Hands-on programming experience and familiarity with several programming languages, open source software, databases & web architecture.
 Broad knowledge of SDLC and proven track record of successfully delivering software projects.
 Excellent business knowledge, ranging from principles of management to writing business plans.
• Proven ability to lead, direct and motivate development teams.

Desirable:
• Experience in an entrepreneurial start-up or in launching a new product.
• Experience with mobile technologies.
Keys to Success

Your technical knowledge is critical, but what will make you — and MEST — a true success is the level of passion and commitment you bring to the enterprise.

Also critical are your:
• Management and leadership skills, particularly the ability to communicate effectively.
• Compassion and empathy necessary to transcend cultural differences.
• Drive and stamina to set goals and reach those goals in the face of challenges.
• Collaborative approach and willingness to be a "team player".
• Effective training & mentoring skills and charismatic presence.
• Sense of humor and the ability to foster a fun environment.

Meltwater Group is an equal opportunity employer. EOE M/F/D/V

We are now accepting and evaluating applications for the start in August 2009 in Ghana. The final interview session will be held end of April.

Please send a letter of interest and your resume/CV to recruitment.faculty@meltwater.org

For more information contact: Kimling Lam, kimling.lam@meltwater.com

To apply: recruitment.faculty@meltwater.org

item.title: readMedia: Talented, Motivated, Experienced Ruby on Rails Application Developer
item.description:
Location: Albany, NY
URL: http://www.readmedia.com/company/about

readMedia is looking for a talented software developer to join a profitable, fast-growing company that is on a path to revolutionize a big segment of the media industry. We have blue-chip backers, paying customers, a proven vision, lots of interesting work for you and a lot of upside.

We are currently working at enhancing and extending our online hyper local press release syndication application, as well as launching many new projects and offerings to better connect the media with the news they need via RSS feeds and efficient search algorithms. Our application relies on many parts working together, as well as very close attention to our clients’ user experience and needs.

You will be a key member of our team and we will trust you with the freedom and responsibility to accomplish readMedia’s goals by writing elegant, stable code. You must be self-motivated and able to excel without someone looking over your shoulder all of the time. We prefer people who are intellectually curious, like to solve problems, and who are passionate about their work. Ideally, you’ll be curious about the business side of what we do and play a role beyond your day-to-day responsibilities. We prefer people who “punch above their weight” and can contribute more than the nuts and bolts listed on a resume.

Specifically, we’re looking for:

• Real world experience developing, deploying and maintaining web-based applications.
• A strong understanding of Object Oriented Programming and design.
• A strong understanding of database design.
• Proficiency in Ruby, Ruby on Rails, SQL, Javascript, HTML/CSS, UNIX, and at least one other object oriented programming language such as Java or C++.
• Someone who (programmatically) tests the code they commit.
• A team player with strong communication skills.

BIG bonus points for:

• B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent.
• Experience programming with geographic data sets and Google Maps.
• Amazon Web Services experience.
• Mongrel, Apache, Memcached, Capistrano, Monit experience.
• UNIX systems administration experience.
• MySQL administration experience.
• An eye for design and the skills to execute.

We subscribe to the Joel Spolsky criteria for all of our employees: people who are,

1. Smart, and…
2. Get things done.

Why work with readMedia?
readMedia offers a very competitive salary, equity, a workplace that encourages you to have a life of your own, and people who appreciate what you can do. We’re not a sweatshop and there’s very little ego here. We value people who contribute thoughtfully and well to our efforts and share our commitment to excellence and dedication to our customers. You will of course also get health and dental, paid holidays, a 401(k) matching plan, paid parking, and a cool looking office.

This job is at our home office in Albany, New York. There are lots of great reasons to live here that we’ll tell you all about when we hear from you.

DO NOT APPLY IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR CONTRACT WORK OR IF YOU’RE A CONTRACT SHOP. THIS IS A FULL-TIME POSITION.

Don’t just send a resume! Please send a cover note that tells us a bit about you, what you’re especially good at or like to work on, why you’re interested in the position, and what you think you bring to the table—this note is a really important requirement.

To apply: Send it to Colin at jobs <at> readMedia <dot> com.

WestEd, a nonprofit research, development, and service agency, works with education and other communities to promote excellence, achieve equity, and improve learning for children, youth, and adults. While WestEd serves the states of Arizona, California, Nevada, and Utah as one of the nation’s Regional Educational Laboratories, our agency’s work extends throughout the United States and abroad. WestEd has 16 offices nationwide, from Washington and Boston to Arizona, Southern California, and its headquarters in San Francisco.

Want to apply your design skills with an organization that is dedicated to improving education and learning? Join our diverse and rapidly growing web team!

WestEd, a nonprofit agency, is a respected leader in the education sector and has been ranked in the top 100 places to work in the SF Bay Area multiple times.

WestEd Interactive, the organization’s web technology group, creates education-related web sites and tools. We help educational organizations build online communities, implement web 2.0 strategies, share and publish research, and perform complex tasks through web applications. As one of the country’s largest not-for-profit development teams in the education industry, we have supported over 100 projects in the past few years.

Position Description
Making technology easy to use—We are seeking an Interaction Designer to join our User Experience group who can strike the right balance between creative and analytical thinking. Participate in concept development, user-centered design, and specifications for a wide variety of projects. Good communication skills and the ability to manage priorities in a fast-paced environment are a must for our busy team. The job is located in our downtown San Francisco office.

Responsibilities
The Interaction Designer will work collaboratively with art director, project manager, tech team and clients to design for web applications, content-based websites, data visualizations, mobile devices and multimedia presentations. Activities include requirements gathering, task analysis, personas, user scenarios, information architecture, interaction design, screen layouts, prototypes, observe or conduct usability testing. Create specifications, ensure usability and that design standards are applied throughout entire site. Graphic design skills are a BIG plus.

Qualifications
- Minimum 4-5 years relevant experience desired (as user interface designer, information architect, web designer)
- Strong understanding of and enthusiasm for user-centered design principles
- Strong visual, verbal and written communication skills, with ability to successfully communicate design rationale to a mixed audience
- A curious outlook and ability to develop new approaches to complex design problems
- Ability to create navigation flowcharts, wireframes/storyboards
- Knowledge of current web technologies and how they create opportunities or limitations for interface design
- Understanding of W3C and 508 accessibility guidelines
- Proficiency with Illustrator and Photoshop (Mac platform preferred)
- Proficiency with OmniGraffle or similar software for flowcharts, wireframes, etc.
- Clean, modern visual design sense for simple and intuitive interfaces
- Links to example projects or portfolio with a clear description of role played for each

Nice to Have
- Graphic design skills: concept development and design graphic systems via screen layout templates, color palettes, iconography, typography, etc.

item.title: The College Board: User Experience Analyst, Dot.Com Department
item.description:
Location: New York, NY or Reston, VA
URL: www.collegeboard.com/careers

The College Board, a national educational organization, is conducting a search for a User Experience Analyst to work within the College Board Dot.Com department. This position can be based out of our New York City or Reston, Virginia office.

POSITION SUMMARY
The User Experience Analyst, working alongside senior user experience team members, will gather customer insights, conduct usability analyses, and create personas; task analyses, page flow diagrams and other artifacts associated with a user-centered design methodology, and develop and present recommendations and findings.

The ideal candidate is an empathetic listener and creative thinker who is passionate about the Web and who can work with ease among team members from various disciplines.

RESPONSIBILITIES
In collaboration with senior user experience team members, will:
• Gather user feedback, develop an understanding of user needs, and create the appropriate tools to translate that understanding into actionable information
• Maintain and build on the College Board’s in house usability practice
• Plan, design and conduct high quality user experience research projects for the Web site and related products (mobile, etc.)
• Oversee the planning, creation and execution of research surveys for the Web site and related products
• Work closely with product teams to provide user insights
• Validate requirements and design solutions with customers and internal users through usability testing, cognitive walkthroughs, heuristic evaluations, and other testing methods
• Document and present research and usability findings and recommendations to development teams
• Create personas, task analyses, task flow diagrams, and information architecture diagrams
• Research and recommend latest best practices in user interface design, barrier free design, and information design, revising established standards and guidelines as warranted

QUALIFICATIONS
2-5 years user research experience (e.g., standard usability testing, eye-tracking, card sorting, focus groups and survey design), user interface/interaction design or development, or visual/information design

Bachelor’s degree required; Master’s a plus. Degrees or studies in anthropology, cognitive or experimental psychology, cognitive science, human factors, human-computer interaction, computer science, or related field a plus

REQUIREMENTS
• Experience with a variety of research methods
Familiarity with Morae or other usability analyst tools
• An understanding of user interface technology and barrier-free and accessible design
• Strong project management and decision-making skills
• Excellent oral and written communications skills
• Able to use insights from user research to provide product strategy and innovation recommendations
• A passion for the Internet and a keen interest in how people think, behave, and feel

The College Board is a national educational association of schools, colleges and universities founded to aid the transition of students from secondary school to higher education. Our mission, “Connect to College Success,” emphasizes both high academic standards and a commitment to prepare all students across the entire social and economic spectrum. We offer our employees an outstanding benefits package, which includes 4 weeks of vacation, a generous retirement plan, tuition reimbursement and ongoing professional development and training.

If you are interested in joining the College Board apply by visiting our website at www.collegeboard.com/careers. Please forward your resume and a cover letter that includes salary expectations. The College Board is dedicated to the principle of equal opportunity and its programs, services and employment policies are guided by that principle.

To apply: Apply by visiting our website at www.collegeboard.com/careers. Please forward your resume and a cover letter that includes salary expectations.

item.title: ShareThis: Team Leader, Web Team
item.description:
Location: Mountain View, CA
URL: http://sharethis.com/

About ShareThis:

ShareThis is a service in the emerging social media space that enables site publishers and site users to utilize a simple one-button option to share site content with others through email, SMS, instant messenger, social networks, and social bookmarking. ShareThis offers a widget for use by publishers, a browser plugin for users and a ShareBox to see and store past shares.

We have already experienced significant growth both in adoption by site publishers and share actions by users. Over 70,000 publishers have incorporated the ShareThis widget driving nearly two billion page views monthly.

Our team shares a deep passion for making sharing simple, bringing together a diverse set of talent and experience from companies such as Advertising.com, Amazon, AOL, IAC, LinkedIn, Nielsen Buzzmetrics, Yahoo! and Google/YouTube. Investors are Draper Fisher Jurvetson, Blue Chip Venture Company, DFJ Mercury, Reservoir Partners, Illinois Ventures, Queen City Angels and RPM Ventures.

The ideal profile:

The idealized candidate is most likely to be a hybrid: part visionary/part architect/and part builder. This needs to be a candidate that is clearly passionate about the large opportunity associated with online advertising, and social media. As such, it demands a person that is extremely attracted to the opportunity and is never satisfied with the results.

The ability to apply innovative technology to business problems and execution comes first for this candidate. It is essential for the candidate to have outstanding technical and product sense. From a technical perspective, the candidate must have direct domain experience in the latest web technologies relevant to user experience such as Ajax, Javascript, PHP, Widget containers, HTML/CSS. The candidate must demonstrate first hand experience in building and deploying large traffic websites and related user interaction elements on the web.

The ideal candidate is likely to come from a company involved in web portals, social networking, or related web 2.0 services.

The job:

The Team Leader will lead a team chartered with design, implementation, and delivery of ShareThis web presence including website, widgets, and various other innovative content delivery artifacts in the future. This is a key initiative for the company since it reflects our presence with users; as such garners significant visibility at senior levels.

The position reports to the Chief Technology Officer.

Responsibilities of this position include:

- Innovative Product Development: The successful candidate will be responsible for innovating and shaping our web presence that benefits consumers, publishers, and partners. You will lead a team to conceptualize product components, technology architecture, implementation and integration between various systems within the company that will collectively work together to deliver a solution. Much of this involves significant innovation in user experience and “breaking new ground”.

- Technology Architecture: As the senior technology leader you will own the platform architecture and insure that it is highly scalable, extensible, and adaptive as it evolves through the next 12-18 months.

- Product Rollout: The product plan is to make significant improvements in the content and method of how users interact with ShareThis web elements through 2009. You will work with Product Management and other technology groups in defining the roadmap, scope, deliverables. You will be responsible to drive an iterative approach to rollout in testing, refining, and improving features based on audience response.

- Business Integration: There are a number of ways to develop and grow our web experience such as web containers that deliver content to users on other sites, and new innovative Ad Units that actively engage users when visible on partner properties, to name a few. You will develop collaborative relationships with our Business Development & Sales teams to help analyze and scope solutions that impact our customers.

Educational Requirements:

B.S/M.S in computer science from a leading school or related technical discipline with a bias towards Information Architecture, and User Experience Design.

Professional traits necessary for all ShareThis team members:

1. Is right a lot.
2. Helps hire and develop great technical talent.
3. Has relentlessly high standards
4. No task is beneath this person.
5. Expects and requires innovation of her/his team.
6. Has conviction.
7. Results oriented.
8. Thinks big.

To apply: Please send your email cover letter and resume with the subject "Your name – Team Leader, Web Team – via 37signals" to jobs@sharethis.com. All communication and correspondence is held in the strictest confidence.
